nodes.text: Galmerah was a graveyard planet located in the galaxy. During the time of the Galactic Empire, a number of bounty hunters visited Galmerah while hunting down Nakano Lash, a fellow bounty hunter who disappeared after an apparent betrayal years prior. While on Galmerah, hunters Bossk and Beilert Valance entered into a skirmish after the latter discovered map coordinates that supposedly led to Lash.
A terrestrial planet with a barren, rocky surface and a breathable atmosphere, Galmerah orbited at least two stars. A species of flying creatures could be found on the planet.

By the time of the Galactic Empire, Galmerah was known as a graveyard planet, with its surface covered with graves and memorials to the dead. Around 3 ABY, the Nautolan bounty hunter Nakano Lash, who had disappeared after betraying fellow hunters in a mission, resurfaced. The rogue archaeologist Doctor Chelli Aphra acquired information that connected Lash to Galmerah, where her parents were buried, and provided the details to the bounty hunter Bossk. The hunter Boba Fett learned of Lash's connection to Galmerah from interrogating the black market technology dealer Jhorstek on the planet Eriadu, while Beilert Valance visited Galmerah after watching a security recording of Jhorstek's interrogation.

On Galmerah, Valance discovered that the grave of Lash's parents was emitting a message in the Nautila language that contained map coordinates. However, before Valance could follow the coordinates, he was attacked by Bossk, who wished to find Lash himself.
Galmerah was inhabited by a number of monks, who claimed to be the caretakers of the souls of those who had died.
A large number of graves and memorials were scattered across the surface of Galmerah, while other graves were suspended above the ground.
Galmerah first appeared in Bounty Hunters 2, a comic written by Ethan Sacks, illustrated by Paolo Villanelli, and published by Marvel Comics on March 25, 2020.
